remarks: One direction of a restricted quantifier version of Theorem 19.36 of [Margaris] p. 90.  In classical logic, the converse would hold if ` A ` has at least one element, but in intuitionistic logic, that is not a sufficient condition.  (Contributed by NM, 22-Oct-2003.)
statement:
r19.36av $p |- ( E. x e. A ( ph -> ps ) -> ( A. x e. A ph -> ps ) ) $.
$d ps x $.
